name: Onikira - Demon Killer
description: Onikira is a 2D side scrolling beat ‘em up set in a fantasy feudal Japan where the player takes on the role of a samurai fighting to prevent the forces of the Japanese underworld from breaking through into the world of the living.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista SP2/ Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 1.8GHz or AMD Athlon X2 64 2GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB ATI HD3650, 256 MB nVidia 8800 GT, or Intel HD 3000 integrated graphics DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c-compatible sound card
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows Vista SP2/ Windows 7/ Windows 8 Processor: 1.8 GHz Quad Core Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: AMD HD5000 series or better, nVidia GT400 series or better, Intel IvyBridge integrated graphics or better DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 4 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c-compatible sound card

reviews.review_text: I absolutly love this game, great gameplay, music is awesome, really unique art style and good enough story. The only negative point I have is, that the game crashes really oft, especially in the beginning of every level
This game is broken don`t buy it. You will expierence several crashes and you even can`t complete the game.

Onikira - Demon Killer is a game that I can't recommend because: - the price is too much for it's quality - it is boring - it has a lot of issues - the game is crashing every time you try to load your save - the game is totally unplayable - the only good reason to install this game is for the trading cards

I needed to review this because no one should buy this game in the state it is in. If you are like me and the 100's of people then you will be able to play this game maybe 2 or 3 levels and be loving this game when suddenly it will crash. And when you come back to try and play the game it will just keep crashing. The 'developers' haven't fixed this issue and they say to reinstall the game or delete your userdata.dat to fix this issue which doesn't fix it. I would say email them with the exact specs they have since they dont seem to have an issue on their system but other people are annoyed by this. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Update: Almost month later, I get an email from the maker say will send this on to the developers or just talk to steam about getting money back. That long to say that they are not working on it or just get money back which shows how much they care about their customers. AGAIN DO NOT BUY.
An excellent game Disregarded by malfunctions A damn shame indeed   Addendum
Until now, i still have no idea why i buy this game !

Poor ripoff of devil may cry and onimusha with none of the smoothness of combat and awesome look. Very poorly translated, the art style goes from needlessly minimalist to breathtaking (though somewhat cheat-y since it uses a lot of blook and flash) though combat tends to get severely bogged down due to filter cluster♥♥♥♥ing. bosses arent put in at the right times and are thrown at you with little pomp or ceremony, and your victory with even less.
